enWisdom: Certitude bears the fruit of indifference towards worldly pleasures
The fruit of certitude is asceticism [and indifference towards worldly pleasures]
Attain certitude (or proficiency) and you will be successful
One who has certitude is successful
One who has certitude is saved
There is no medium more successful than faith
Religion is light, certitude is joy

Wisdom: الظَّنُّ يُخْطِئُ وَالْيَقِينُ يُصِيبُ وَلَا يُخْطِئُ
enWisdom: Conjecture errs, but certainty is [always] right and does err

Wisdom: الْمُوقِنُ أَشَدُّ النَّاسِ حُزْناً عَلَى نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: The possessor of certitude is the most sorrowful of all people about [the condition of] his soul

Wisdom: أَيْنَ الْمُوقِنُونَ الَّذِينَ خَلَعُوا سَرَابِيلَ الْهَوَى وَقَطَعُوا عَنْهُمْ عَلَائِقَ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: Where are the possessors of certitude who have cast off the attires of vain desire and cut themselves off from the ties of this world?
The cause of sincerity is certitude
Have certitude and you will become strong

Wisdom: لَوْ صَحَّ يَقِينُكَ لَمَا اسْتَبْدَلْتَ الْفَانِيَ بِالْبَاقِي وَلَا بِعْتَ السَّنِيَّ بِالدَّنِيِّ
enWisdom: If your certitude was sound, you would not have exchanged the everlasting for the evanescent, nor would you have traded the lofty for the lowly
One whose conviction is firm, his worship becomes good

Wisdom: يُسْتَدَلُّ عَلَى الْيَقِينِ بِقَصْرِ الْأَمَلِ وَإِخْلَاصِ الْعَمَلِ وَالزُّهْدِ فِي الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: Certitude is evinced by the shortening of hopes, sincerity in action and indifference towards the pleasures of this world
